candidates.title: [backport] Fix git rev showing up in version number
candidates.body:
Makefiles didn't support an out-of-tree build, so needed to update them to do
so.

Backport https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/3398

candidates.title: Bump libz-sys to 1.0.9
candidates.body:
This just switches libz to always link statically instead of relying on the
system zlib. For MinGW it seems that linkage may default pull in a DLL, which is
almost never what we want.

Closes #3384

candidates.title: Compile statically against the MSVC CRT
candidates.body:
This updates our AppVeyor builds to compile with `-Ctarget-feature=+crt-static`
to help Cargo be a bit more portable and not rely on the MSVC redistributable
artifacts. Over time this may even let us converge on only releasing one build
of Cargo and just pairing that with all Windows toolchains...

candidates.title: Backporting fixes to 1.14.0
candidates.body:
This is a backport of the following PRs to fix the actual issue, https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/37969.

* https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/3311 - first attempt to fix OpenSSL linkage on OSX
* https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/3315 - second attempt to fix linkage
* https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/3325 - fix a flaky test causing lots of CI problems
* https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/3332 - actual fix for OpenSSL linkage on OSX
* https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/3345 - first PR for automation changes
* https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/issues/3350 - second PR for automation changes
* https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/3326 - update git2 to support netbsd
* https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/3331 - update git2 to fix segfaults in tests
* https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo/pull/3342 - update git2 to fix cert paths

candidates.title: Bump git2 dep to fix SSL paths
candidates.body:
This commit includes alexcrichton/git2-rs@a8f4a7faa which switches the order of
initialization of libgit2. That commit ensures that the relevant env vars which
a statically linked OpenSSL needs to function are set before libgit2 is
initialized to ensure that libgit2 uses them.

This was regressed accidentally in alexcrichton/git2-rs@071902aa when
initialization was tweaked.

Closes #3340

candidates.title: Update git2 fixing initialization races
candidates.body:
This updates libgit2/libssh2 bindings to fix initialization races in
OpenSSL. This should fix some of the spurious segfaults we've been
seeing on Travis OSX.

candidates.title: Update dependencies for OpenSSL 1.1.0 compatibility
candidates.body:
The primary targets here are openssl and openssl-sys crates 0.9,
bringing support for OpenSSL 1.1.0.  This requires updating the curl
and git2 related dependencies as well.

A small change is required in cargo itself for the new Hasher API.
Results from the hasher are simply unwrapped for now, matching the
Windows behavior that already panics on error.
